item.title: Death to the spinner: event sourcing for reactive web apps
item.description:
Description

Chris May shows how to use Flask, SSE, and Datastar to build a reactive UI with introspectable data, all with Jinja templates and a single codebase.
item.dc:creator: Chris May

item.title: Let’s PyScript: Flask frontends in Python!
item.description:
Description

Nicholas Tollervey live codes a chat system with a Flask API and PyScript UI. He and Paul Everitt talk about how PyScript works, and then take Q&A from the audience through the newly created app. Presented at FlaskCon 2025.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Tollervey

item.title: Python’s New Template Strings and Flask
item.description:
Description

Dave Peck and Paul Everitt describe how their new PEP 750 t-strings template strings work. They demonstrate problems that t-strings solve, and show how they might be used to write a new template system or enhance an existing one. Presented at FlaskCon 2025.
item.dc:creator: Dave Peck

item.title: Testing Flask and Quart apps with Playwright
item.description:
Description

Pamela Fox shows how Playwright can be used to write and run tests against a Flask/Quart app in a browser. Presented at FlaskCon 2025.
item.dc:creator: Pamela Fox

item.title: Turning Data into an Interactive Artwork That Tells a Story
item.description:
Description

Diane Phan describes her love of movies, music, and programming, and how she combined those into a fun app to share and map music memories. The audience is invited to use the live app during the talk. Presented at FlaskCon 2025.
item.dc:creator: Diane Phan
